reviewText: oldie but goodie. Nothing to do with the awful morbid recent documentaries from Discovery or Animal Planet! this is a good one!

This is an interesting look into predator/prey dynamics with an emphasis on ecology and the importance of predator conservation.  There were bits relating to the evolutionary history of predators which were also nice.  Robert Redford does a great job narrating and definitely isn't too "preachy" for me.  Conservation is something that everyone should be concerned with.

Absolutely beautiful photography.  I don't know how they got some of the pictures.  I was amazed by the shrew that swims underwater to hunt fish.  The dialogue is pretty simplistic and kind of "preachy" about protecting nature.  That being said, I would still watch other videos from Marty Stouffer.
one of the best nature documentaries I've ever seen!  50min - perfect gift
Really like this episode - but the video quality is not good. More like a bad Youtube video
Servival of the fittest, animals in a very humane viewing. It's educational for most ages, but not for preschool or young elementary school age children.  A great purchase and wholesome family shows.
All of Wild America is fantastic.
